entry.answer: Draupadi was the daughter of King Drupada, a ruler of the Panchala kingdom. Her marriage to the five Pandavas (Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna, Nakula, and Sahadeva) was controversial because it involved polyandry, which challenged societal norms. The text highlights debates about dharma (duty) and whether this union was justified, with Yudhishthira asserting that Draupadi was legally the wife of all five brothers.
